author: Alicia Clanton
description: California Governor Gavin Newsom threatened to pull “billions of dollars” in state funding from any California university that signs a Trump administration proposal offering preferential funding in exchange for certain demands, including a cap on international students.
title: Newsom Threatens Funding Cuts to Colleges That Sign Trump Deal

author: Martha Viotti Beck
description: Brazil’s Development Bank and the Export-Import Bank of China agreed to create a $1 billion fund that will invest in sectors such as energy transition, infrastructure, mining, agriculture and artificial intelligence.
title: Brazil and China Team Up to Create New Investment Fund

author: Madlin Mekelburg
description: A federal judge recused himself from hearing Oregon’s challenge to President Donald Trump’s decision to send National Guard troops into Portland after government lawyers alleged he may have a conflict of interest.
title: Judge Off Oregon National Guard Case After DOJ Claims Conflict

author: Courtney McBride
description: Germany awarded its highest honor to former US Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin, praising a former Biden administration official whose legacy has been upended by his successor, Pete Hegseth.
title: Germany Honors Biden’s Defense Chief as Hegseth Changes Pentagon

author: Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, health policy reporter Rachel Cohrs Zhang looks at the fight over Obamacare subsidies at the heart of the standoff on government funding. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: The Healthcare Issue at the Center of the Shutdown Fight

author: Sarah Holder, Rachael Lewis-Krisky
description: On today’s Big Take podcast: If six-figure earners in New York can’t make it there, who can? We unpack the squeezed rental market in America’s largest city.
title: Rent Is Too High in NYC. Even If You Make Six Figures

author: Courtney McBride, Roxana Tiron
description: The Trump administration has determined that the US is engaged in a “non-international armed conflict” with Latin American drug cartels, according to a notification to Congress, offering further legal justification for recent strikes on alleged drug-runners from Venezuela.
title: Trump Declares Cartels in ‘Armed Conflict’ Against US Military

author: Andreina Itriago
description: Venezuela said its military is dismantling guerrilla camps along the Colombian border that were stocked with cocaine, firearms and detonators.
title: Venezuela Raids Rebel Border Camps Stashed With Drugs and Guns

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: Italy’s cabinet approved a budget featuring a deficit at just 3% of output this year, allowing Premier Giorgia Meloni’s government to set aside more money for tax cuts and defense.
title: Italy Reaches 3% Deficit With Meloni Pushing Tax Cuts, Defense

author: Laura Noonan
description: The European Union’s progress toward a multitrillion euro savings and investment union is being hampered by member states defending their own national interests, the bloc’s financial services chief said Thursday evening.
title: EU Nations Need Unity on Savings Union Plan, Commissioner Says

author: Andreina Itriago
description: Venezuela accused the US of threatening its security after at least five American combat planes approached its coastline, Defense Minister Vladimir Padrino said Thursday.
title: Venezuela Accuses US of Flying Military Aircraft Near Its Coast

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski, Kateryna Chursina
description: Ukraine may be able to acquire longer-range weapons from the US in order to counter increasingly deadly Russian airstrikes, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Thursday.
title: Zelenskiy Sees Chance for More Long-Range Weapons on Trump Talks

author: William Horobin
description: European Central Bank Governing Council Member Francois Villeroy de Galhau called for policymakers to strengthen the international role of the euro, including by increasing the issuance of safe assets.
title: ECB’s Villeroy Urges Bold Steps to Bolster Euro’s Global Role

author: Marcelo Rochabrun
description: Lima’s mayor is reveling in a victory over Brookfield Asset Management, which is dissolving its Peru toll road company citing losses and harassment by local authorities.
title: Lima Mayor Gloats in Victory Over Brookfield’s Peru Toll Company

author: Sanne Wass
description: Greenland is seeking closer ties with the European Union after getting more financial support from the bloc, a rebuke to US President Donald Trump’s ambition to woo the Arctic territory.
title: Greenland Deepens EU Ties in Rebuff to Trump’s Bid for Influence

author: Georgia Hall, Laura Nahmias
description: New York mayoral front-runner and Democratic nominee Zohran Mamdani said he wants to end the city’s gifted and talented program for kindergarten students in public schools, wading into a contentious issue weeks before the election.
title: Mamdani Says He Would Eliminate Gifted Programs From NYC Schools

author: Paul Richardson
description: European and other foreign governments called for restraint after several people died in youth-led protests in Madagascar.
title: Europe Urges Restraint After 22 Killed in Madagascar Protests

author: Foster Wong
description: Beijing warned the top US envoy in Hong Kong against interfering in the country’s internal affairs, days after she reportedly invited pro-democracy former politicians to her inaugural receptions.
title: Beijing Lays Out ‘Must-Nots’ for Top US Diplomat in Hong Kong

author: Daniel Flatley
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent predicted a “pretty big breakthrough” in the next round of trade talks with China, even as the Trump administration takes steps to support American farmers hurt by a decline in Chinese purchases.
title: Bessent Sees China Progress as Soy Fight Echoes Rare Earth Spat

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney created a new Defense Investment Agency to build domestic manufacturing and accelerate the rearming of the Canadian military, aiming to boost sectors such as steel that have been damaged by US tariffs.
title: Carney Starts New Defense Agency, Names RBC’s Guzman to Lead It

author: Alicia Diaz, Kate Sullivan, Erik Wasson
description: President Donald Trump is weighing slashing “thousands” of federal jobs ahead of a meeting with his budget director, Russell Vought, as the White House looks to ratchet up pressure on Democrats to end a government shutdown that has entered its second day.
title: Trump Eyes Firing ‘Thousands’ of Federal Workers Over Shutdown

description: Migrantes que anhelan ver a sus familias, a quienes dejaron atrás cuando EE.UU. les retiró la bienvenida, ilustran la dinámica cambiante de la nación sudamericana.
title: Por qué algunos venezolanos están regresando después de años en el exterior

author: Agnieszka Barteczko
description: Poland reported an unspecified incident on its Baltic coast, Prime Minister Donald Tusk said as he met with European leaders to discuss a raft of hybrid attacks from Russia.
title: Polish Premier Tusk Cites Unspecified Incident on Baltic Coast

description: Migrants yearning to see family left behind as the US withdraws the welcome mat illustrate the South American nation’s shifting dynamics.
title: Why Some Venezuelans Are Turning Back Home After Years Abroad

author: Michael Vilensky
description: A burgeoning bloc of New York City Republicans say Andrew Cuomo should make an appeal for a vote in his favor in November’s mayoral election.
title: NYC’s Mayoral Race Has Republicans Telling Cuomo: Come Woo Us

author: Alex Morales, William Standring
description: At least two people were killed in a terrorist attack on a synagogue in Manchester, raising concerns about antisemitism and wider community tensions in the UK.
title: UK Synagogue Attack Kills Two, Fueling Fears of Antisemitism

author: Souhail Karam
description: North African nation shaken by worst upheaval since the 2011 Arab Spring.
title: Morocco’s Angry Youth Joins Wave of Gen Z Rage

author: Firat Kozok
description: Turkey anticipates settling a long-running dispute with the US administration over sanctions busting allegations against state lender Turkiye Halk Bankasi AS with a manageable fine, according to a person familiar with the matter.
title: Turkey Anticipates Manageable Fine to Settle Halkbank-US Dispute

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: The European Union plans to hike tariffs on steel imports to 50% and cut by nearly a half the volume of steel that’s allowed in before that higher rate is imposed, according to a draft proposal seen by Bloomberg.
title: EU to Propose Doubling Tariff Rate on Steel Imports to 50%

author: Josh Xiao
description: Chinese state media outlets have defended a new visa program to attract global talent after many residents expressed worries over losing jobs to foreigners as youth unemployment jumped to a two-year high.
title: China State Media Defends New Talent Visa, Downplays Job Worries

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union’s bid to unlock funding for Ukraine from frozen Russian central bank assets faced resistance as Belgium raised legal questions about the plan to tap financing from up to €185 billion ($217 billion) held on its territory.
title: Belgium Pours Cold Water on EU Plan to Tap Russian Assets

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski, Kateryna Chursina
description: A Russian barrage against Ukraine’s Black Sea city of Odesa left thousands without power after sudden flooding killed at least 10 people.
title: Russian Drone Attack Cuts Power in Ukraine’s Port City of Odesa After Deadly Floods

author: Ted Mann, Catherine Lucey, Mark Niquette
description: The US government shutdown entered its second day with the Trump administration having raised the stakes in its showdown with Democrats, first by punishing the home city of its two leading antagonists and then by signaling a willingness to fire thousands of federal workers, despite some Republicans’ concerns that the strategy could backfire.
title: Trump Raises Stakes for GOP in Shutdown With Layoff Threats

author: Souhail Karam
description: Morocco’s most serious wave of unrest since the Arab Spring turned deadly overnight, escalating youth-led protests over poor public services and heavy spending for the 2030 football World Cup.
title: Morocco’s Gen Z Protests Turn Deadly After Police Clashes

description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israeli naval forces boarded most of the vessels in a flotilla attempting to break Israel’s blockade of Gaza on Thursday and detained dozens aboard, including European lawmakers, drawing widespread condemnation.
title: Israeli Navy Intercepts Flotilla Boats, Detains Activists

author: Chandra Asmara
description: Indonesia’s armed forces has begun distributing military-produced medicines and vitamins in support of President Prabowo Subianto’s priority social programs, underscoring its expanding role in civilian life in the Southeast Asian nation.
title: Indonesian Military Steps Into Public Health With Medicines Push

author: Peter Laca
description: Investors are snapping up shares in the Czech Republic’s biggest power utility, betting a potential win for the billionaire challenger in this week’s election will unlock a lucrative government stock buyout.
title: Buyout Bets for $34 Billion Czech Utility Face Election Test

author: Samy Adghirni
description: French unions are holding a new round of anti-austerity protests Thursday, seeking to maintain pressure on Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu as he struggles to pull together a budget proposal.
title: French Unions Hold Fresh Protests to Pressure Lecornu on Budget

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: The Trump Administration sent letters to a group of top-tier universities Wednesday laying out a proposed compact that would cap international students, ban the use of race or sex in hiring, and require standardized testing as part of the admissions process in exchange for preferential access to federal funding.
title: White House Floats New Rules For Colleges to Get Funding Edge

author: Todd Gillespie, Annie Massa
description: After years getting shunned by major banks, Donald Trump’s money has found another place to call home: Citigroup Inc.
title: Trump’s Wealth, Once Spurned by Banks, Finds a New Home at Citi

author: Ari Natter
description: The Trump administration’s plan to cancel billions of dollars for energy projects following the US government shutdown includes an initiative to upgrade electric transmission lines in California.
title: Trump’s $7.6 Billion Energy Cuts Hit California Grid Upgrade

author: Swati Gupta
description: India’s Hindu nationalist group that nurtured Narendra Modi and his ruling party will assemble thousands of members on Thursday, offering important clues about support for the prime minister at a time when he’s facing multiple challenges.
title: Hindu Nationalist Group’s Meeting to Offer Clues on Modi Support

author: Heesu Lee
description: South Korea may move to unveil a new security agreement with the US before concluding trade talks, as negotiations on economic issues drag on, according to the foreign ministry.
title: Seoul Likely to Unveil Security Pact With US Before Trade Deal

author: Ruth Carson, Faris Mokhtar
description: Indonesia’s finance minister once wanted to run the country’s central bank. Now, he just wants to tell it what to do.
title: Indonesia’s Central Bank Faces Growing Threats to Independence
